quis_description: Understand your organisation's readiness for AI adoption

questions.text: How well defined are your organisation's digital transformation goals?

options.text: We have no formal digital strategy
We have discussed digital goals but nothing documented
We have documented digital goals but no clear implementation plan
We have clear, documented digital goals with implementation roadmaps

questions.text: How would you describe your organisation's approach to data management?

options.text: We store data but don't actively manage or analyse it
We track key metrics but data is scattered across systems
We have centralised data storage and regular reporting
We have robust data governance and analytics capabilities

questions.text: What is your team's current level of AI and digital tool literacy?

options.text: Limited - most staff use only basic digital tools
Moderate - some staff are comfortable with digital tools
Good - most staff regularly use digital tools and are open to learning
Advanced - team actively explores and adopts new technologies

questions.text: How would you rate your current technology infrastructure?

options.text: Outdated systems with frequent issues
Basic systems that meet current needs but limited scalability
Modern systems with cloud services and regular updates
Cutting-edge infrastructure with APIs and integration capabilities

questions.text: How does your organisation approach innovation and change?

options.text: We prefer to stick with proven methods
We're cautious but will adopt when others have proven success
We actively seek opportunities to improve processes
We have a culture of experimentation and continuous improvement

questions.text: What resources can your organisation commit to AI initiatives?

options.text: Very limited - we're focused on day-to-day operations
Some capacity - we could allocate a few hours per week
Moderate capacity - we have budget and time for pilot projects
Strong capacity - we have dedicated resources for innovation

questions.text: How documented and standardised are your key business processes?

options.text: Most processes are informal and undocumented
Key processes are understood but not formally documented
Most processes are documented with some standardisation
Comprehensive process documentation with continuous improvement

questions.text: How familiar is your leadership team with AI capabilities and use cases?

options.text: Limited awareness - AI seems complex and distant
Basic awareness - we've heard about AI but unclear on applications
Good awareness - we understand potential use cases for our sector
Strong awareness - we're actively exploring specific AI opportunities

strategy.name: Strategic Planning
strategy.description: Clear vision and goals for digital transformation

data.name: Data Readiness
data.description: Ability to collect, manage and analyse data effectively

skills.name: Team Capabilities
skills.description: Staff skills and willingness to adopt new technologies

infrastructure.name: Technical Infrastructure
infrastructure.description: Quality and scalability of existing technology systems

resources.name: Resource Availability
resources.description: Time, budget and commitment for AI initiatives

awareness.name: AI Awareness
awareness.description: Understanding of AI capabilities and opportunities

score_bands.summary: Your organisation is in the early stages of digital readiness. Focus on building foundational capabilities before pursuing AI initiatives.
recommendations: Start with basic digital literacy training for your team
Identify one or two areas where better data tracking could help
Attend introductory workshops on AI for business
score_bands.next_steps: Consider our Foundation Workshop package to help your team understand AI basics and identify quick wins.

score_bands.summary: Your organisation has some digital capabilities in place but needs strengthening before scaling AI adoption.
recommendations: Improve data collection and management practices
Pilot small AI tools for specific use cases (e.g., content generation)
Build a clearer digital transformation roadmap
Invest in upskilling key team members
score_bands.next_steps: Our Tier 1 Workshop and Mentoring package could help you run focused pilots and build momentum.

score_bands.summary: Your organisation has good foundations and is ready to actively experiment with AI tools and approaches.
recommendations: Launch pilot AI projects in 2-3 areas (e.g., marketing, operations)
Establish clear success metrics for AI initiatives
Build internal champions who can support broader adoption
Consider how AI can support your strategic goals
score_bands.next_steps: Our Tier 2 Full Engagement package provides hands-on support plus insights to guide your AI strategy.

score_bands.summary: Your organisation is well-positioned for AI adoption and can pursue ambitious initiatives with confidence.
recommendations: Develop a comprehensive AI adoption roadmap across functions
Invest in advanced AI capabilities (custom models, automation)
Share your learnings to position as an innovation leader
score_bands.next_steps: Our Tier 3 Programme Pilot can help you develop a sector-leading AI capability and document your approach.
